Package Model

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
A class consisting of parts and products as its data members. Parts and products are each held in an ArrayList data structure, called ObservableList. All parts are held in the partInventory list; all products are held in the productInventory list. The Inventory class also provides methods for manipulating the stock of parts and products.

  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public void addPart​(Part part)
      Adds parts to the part inventory.
      Parameters:
      part - An instance of a Part object to be added to the part inventory.

    • deletePart

      public boolean deletePart​(Part selectedPart)
      Deletes parts from the part inventory. First, this method checks whether the part selected equates to null, i.e. whether a part was selected. If null, then user is advised to select a part. Otherwise, the method then proceeds to confirm the intent to delete and proceeds accordingly. Upon deletion, the method confirms that the item is deleted.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - An instance of a Part object to be removed from the part inventory.

    • updatePart

      public void updatePart​(int index, Part part)
      Updates a part within the current inventory.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the part to be modified.
      part - An instance of a Part object to be modified in the part inventory.

    • lookupPart

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookupPart​(String partName)
      Searches the part inventory by part name.
      Parameters:
      partName - The search term to match part names against.
      Returns:
      A list of all parts whose name matches the given search term, partName. Otherwise, returns null if no match is found.

    • lookupPart

      public Part lookupPart​(int partId)
      Searches the part inventory by part ID.
      Parameters:
      partId - The search term to match part IDs against.
      Returns:
      A part object whose ID matches the given search term, partId. Otherwise, returns null if no match is found.

    • getPartInventory

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getPartInventory()
      Outputs the current list of all parts in the inventory.
      Returns:
      The list of all part objects currently held in inventory.

    • getPartIdIndex

      public int getPartIdIndex()
      Outputs an incremental index to be used for indexing parts added to inventory.
      Returns:
      A numerical index that is incremented from the previously-assigned index.

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct​(Product product)
      Adds a new product to the product inventory.

    • lookupProduct

      public Product lookupProduct​(int productId)
      Searches the product inventory by product ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - The search term to match product IDs against.
      Returns:
      A product object whose ID matches the given search term, productId. Otherwise, returns null if no match is found.

    • lookupProduct

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookupProduct​(String productName)
      Searches the product inventory by product name.
      Parameters:
      productName - The search term to match product names against.
      Returns:
      A list of products whose name matches the given search term, productName. Otherwise, returns null if no match is found.

    • updateProduct

      public void updateProduct​(int index, Product product)
      Updates a product within the current inventory.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the product to be modified.
      product - An instance of a product object to be modified in the product inventory.

    • deleteProduct

      public boolean deleteProduct​(Product selectedProduct)
      Deletes products from the product inventory. This method first checks if any product is selected (i.e. not null), and if so, proceeds check whether any parts are asosciated with that product. If selected product has associated parts, then a warning is output to advise that the product cannot be deleted until its associated parts are removed first. Otherwise, if no associated parts are found, the user is asked to confirm the intent to delete and then proceeds accordingly. If, at the outset, the selected product equates to null, then the user is advised that a a product must be selected first.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - An instance of a product object to be removed from the product inventory.

    • getProductInventory

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getProductInventory()
      Outputs the current list of all products in the inventory.
      Returns:
      The list of all product objects currently held in inventory.

    • getProductIdIndex

      public int getProductIdIndex()
      Outputs an incremental index to be used for indexing products added to inventory.
      Returns:
      A numerical index that is incremented from the previously-assigned index.

    • inputValidator

      public static String inputValidator​(String name, int stock, double price, int min, int max, String errorOutput)
      Validates user inputs in text fields for all Add/Modify screens. Checks for blank names, stock and price values that are less than 1, and inventory values that have a minimum greater than maximum or a stock that is not within the range of maximum and minimum values. If any of these errors are detected, the string errorOutput will be updated accordingly and output to the screen.
      Returns:
      A string value that can hold one to five separate lines of error warnings.
